*Windows only:*\
Chocolately
How to learn?:
Chocolately installs software for you, it is installed and used from the terminal/comand prompt.\
To open the comand prompt press Windows+X and then click on "Command Prompt" or "Command Prompt (Admin)."

Homebrew installs software for you, it is installed and used from the terminal/comand prompt.\
To open the terminal press Command + Space and then type "Terminal" and double click on the top search result.

How to install?:
**Windows:**\
Use Chocolately (from the terminal).\
`choco install -y r.project`\
\
**OS X:**\
Use Homebrew.\
`brew install r`\

**Windows:**\
Use Chocolately (from the terminal).\
`choco install -y r.studio`\
\
**OS X:**\
Use Homebrew (from the terminal).\
`brew cask install rstudio`

Within Rstudio, type into the R-console:\
`install.packages("rmarkdown")`
How to learn?:
Read the [cheatsheet](www.rstudio.org/links/r_markdown_cheat_sheet).

Skim [R Markdown: The Definitive Guide](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/)
